system_prompt:
You are an expert GIS Technical Support AI Agent specializing in Esri ArcGIS products and geospatial technologies. 

Your role is to:
1. Analyze GIS-related support tickets
2. Categorize issues accurately
3. Determine appropriate priority levels
4. Generate helpful, technical responses
5. Create actionable resolution plans

Categories you work with:
- arcgis_pro: ArcGIS Desktop Pro software issues
- web_mapping: ArcGIS Online, Portal, web applications
- data_issues: Spatial data, layers, geodatabases
- permissions: Access rights, authentication, sharing
- printing: Map layouts, exports, large format printing
- mobile: Field apps (Collector, Survey123, Workforce)
- geocoding: Address matching and coordinate services
- general: General inquiries and other issues

Priority Levels:
- high: System down, data corruption, blocking production
- medium: Feature not working, workflow disruption
- low: Enhancement requests, training questions

Respond professionally with technical accuracy and provide step-by-step solutions when possible.
user_prompt:
Analyze this GIS support ticket and provide a comprehensive response:

Ticket ID: temp_20250711_134715
Subject: Response Generation Request
Description: Analyze this GIS support ticket and provide a comprehensive response:

Ticket ID: 159552407
Subject: GIS Application - Update the 2018 and 2024 Pavement Condition Comparision
Description: Leighton, You started by creating this application in March. Since then, Alex has made internal and public-facing dashboards for the 2024 PCI. I want you to continue building out this application. https://wpbgisportal.wpb.org/portal/home/item.html?id=8f6a97a50b4f4e5b98885ed8f5c188a1 Add the 2024 map service (verify this URL with Alex) to the 2024 map. West Palm Beach Road Conditions - Webmap is for Public Facing Dashboard - Overview https://wpbgisportal.wpb.org/portal/home/item.html?id=8f6a97a50b4f4e5b98885ed8f5c188a1 The segments were symbolized from the category field. I want you to symbolize the 2018 map the same way, Back in March when we first showed it Engineering pointed out that the 2018 map category values were incorrect (they did not align with the PCI values) so the category values will need to be recalculated in a copy of the geodatabase layer. Create a new ArcPro project make a copy of the 2018 geodatabase layer in the default project database and update the category field using the values provided below.

Please provide:
1. Category classification
2. Priority assessment
3. Detailed technical response with solution steps
4. Action plan for resolution

Format your response as JSON:
{
    "category": "category_name",
    "priority": "high|medium|low",
    "confidence": 0.95,
    "suggested_response": "Detailed technical response here...",
    "action_plan": ["Step 1", "Step 2", "Step 3"],
    "estimated_resolution_time": "X hours/days",
    "required_skills": ["skill1", "skill2"]
}

Please provide:
1. Category classification
2. Priority assessment
3. Detailed technical response with solution steps
4. Action plan for resolution

Format your response as JSON:
{
    "category": "category_name",
    "priority": "high|medium|low",
    "confidence": 0.95,
    "suggested_response": "Detailed technical response here...",
    "action_plan": ["Step 1", "Step 2", "Step 3"],
    "estimated_resolution_time": "X hours/days",
    "required_skills": ["skill1", "skill2"]
}

usage_instructions.step1: Copy the 'system_prompt' to your AI model's system message
usage_instructions.step2: Copy the 'user_prompt' to your AI model's user input
usage_instructions.step3: Run the model and get JSON response
usage_instructions.step4: Use the response in your ticket management system
